intro: Draba spegazziniana, commonly known as the Spegazzini's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small annual or biennial herb with basal leaves and a flowering stem that bears numerous tiny white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. Draba spegazziniana is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
